description: This is a Python source file defining functions and asynchronous routines for seeding development user accounts in a database. It includes logic to check environment variables, create or update users with specific roles, and seed default admin and user accounts for development purposes.

methods.name: bool _truthy_env(value: Optional[str], default: bool = False)
methods.description: Interprets environment variable values as boolean, considering common truthy strings.

methods.name: bool _should_seed_default()
methods.description: Determines whether to seed by default based on environment variables and database URL.

methods.name: None _ensure_user(session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: bool = True)
methods.description: Ensures a user exists with specified email, password, role, and activation status; creates or updates as necessary.

methods.name: None maybe_seed_dev_users()
methods.description: Main async function to seed default development users based on environment flags and variables.

ctags.name: _ensure_user
ctags.pattern: /^async def _ensure_user(session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: b/
ctags.signature: (session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: bool = True)
